Name: Diabetes Association of Atlanta
Address:
75 Marietta Street NW, Suite 304
Atlanta, GA 30303
Notes: The Diabetes Association of Atlanta (DAA) is a nonprofit agency founded in 1952 that provides comprehensive programs for diabetes prevention and management in the metro Atlanta area

Name: American Diabetes Association
Notes: The American Diabetes Association (ADA) is a non-profit voluntary health organization that works to prevent and cure diabetes and to improve the lives of all people affected by it

Name: Georgia Department of Public Health
Address:
200 Piedmont Avenue, SE
Atlanta, GA 30334 US
Notes: Provides information on the Georgia Diabetes Prevention and Control Program and links to ADA Recognized Diabetes Self-Management Education and Support Programs.

Name: Atlanta Diabetes Associates
Notes: A medical practice focused on proactive care and management for individuals with diabetes.

Name: YMCA of Metro Atlanta – Diabetes Prevention Program
Address: Leadership & Learning Center: 569 Martin Luther King Jr Dr NW, Atlanta, GA 30314
Notes: Offers a year‐long lifestyle change program (the “Y Diabetes Prevention Program”) for individuals at risk of Type 2 diabetes. Focus on nutrition, physical activity, behavior change.

Name: Piedmont Healthcare – Diabetes Resource Centers
Notes: Provides comprehensive diabetes education and care (for Type 1, Type 2, gestational, pre‐diabetes), via a multidisciplinary team (endocrinologists, dietitians, exercise specialists) at multiple Georgia locations

Name: Emory University – Lifestyle Medicine Clinic
Address: Emory School of Medicine / Preventive Medicine Division, Atlanta, GA
Notes: A clinic that emphasizes lifestyle change (nutrition, exercise, stress management) for chronic diseases including diabetes and pre‐diabetes. Good option if you prefer a medical setting with wellness focus.
